hackathon-description-text: Congratulations on being a part of the first ever community college

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Digital Strategy at Moviepilot.com
Director of Tech at Science, Inc in Santa Monica

hackathon-requirements:
A valid submission is a software or hardware hack produced at HackCC, from start to finish.
This includes a ChallengePost submission to HackCC and a demonstration during the Hack Expo on Sunday, Nov 9th. Please include a video or photo of the working product.
hackathon-rules:
- No soldering
- No alcohol 
- Don't be a jerk

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue 8 Pro tablets for the team provided by MLH, and $800 provided by Private Internet Access!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Versal API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 cold hard cash to fund your future in hacking!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Mailjet API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $250 to fund your future in hacking!
The team that best implements the Yo API will receive $500!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Yo API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The best project focused on improving living conditions,
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Social Impact Hack - The Honest Co.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team that best implements Myos in their hack will receive free Myos for the team courtesy of MLH!

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack practical given its target audience? Is it something that the user base would actually use? Does it fulfill a need people have?
Is the hack more than just another generic social app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well-designed?

hackathon-description-header: HackCC has taken over Cross Campus in sunny Santa Monica to host the most exciting event of the year for Computer Science, and Engineering students in community colleges all across California!
